name: soupy
content:
soupy adjective
(THICK & WET)
Add to word list
Add to word list
slightly thick and wet, like soup: Add the milk to the sauce in batches and stir, stopping before it gets too soupy. It was okay I suppose, but I prefer a soupier chowder.
More examplesFewer examplesPurée the vegetables with enough water to give a soupy consistency.A soupy mixture of flour, water, and yeast is used as the first stage in making this bread.Intensive use of high pressure water hoses temporarily turns the beaches into a soupy mess.

soupy adjective
(ATMOSPHERE)
with a lot of cloud, fog, or smog (= a mixture of smoke, gases, and chemicals in the air, especially in cities): We could just see the mountains through the soupy haze to the east. Even on the soupiest of days, you can usually see some blue sky here.
